intro: Lasianthus culionensis, commonly known as Culion bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
